bibl.title: with contributions by several authors, The Roman Imperial Quarries Survey and Excavation at Mons Porphyrites, 1994-1998. Volume I. Topography and Quarries.
bibl.note: nombr. fac-sim., figg., cartes, plans, pll.

1. Introduction. - 2. The Central Complex. - 3. The Quarry Villages. - 4. The Quarries. - 5. Infrastructure. - 6. Pottery. - 7. Geology, Mineralogy and Characterization of Porphyry. - Overview and Conclusion. - Pp. 60-62: Wilfried VAN RENGEN, The dedication of Caius Cominius Leugas, 23 July AD 18 (= S.E.G. XLV, 2097).
bibl.seg: MAXFIELD Valerie and David PEACOCK, with contributions by several authors, The Roman Imperial Quarries Survey and Excavation at Mons Porphyrites, 1994-1998. Volume I. Topography and Quarries. (Excavation Memoirs. 67.)
London, Egypt Exploration Society, 2001, 4°, xi-339 pp., nombr. fac-sim., figg., cartes, plans, pll. ISBN 0-85698-152-4. £66.

1. Introduction. - 2. The Central Complex. - 3. The Quarry Villages. - 4. The Quarries. - 5. Infrastructure. - 6. Pottery. - 7. Geology, Mineralogy and Characterization of Porphyry. - Overview and Conclusion. - Pp. 60-62: Wilfried VAN RENGEN, The dedication of Caius Cominius Leugas, 23 July AD 18 (= S.E.G. XLV, 2097).

C.R. par James A. Harrell, JEA 89 (2003) pp. 280-283. - Paul Heilporn, ChrEg 79 (2004) Nos 157-158, pp. 365-366. - Willemina Z. Wendrich, BibO 59 (2002) coll. 550-552. - Marguerite Rassart-Debergh, Latomus 68 (2009) pp. 278-280.
